intro: Ascarina subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. The flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly the native honeyeater, making it an important species for ecological biodiversity.
